intro: Bonellia brunnescens, commonly known as the brown bonellia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a sprawling, shrub-like habit. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Bonellia brunnescens is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky outcrops.
